channel.title: Port Forwarding "Firewall problem", need quick help
channel.description:
Alright, I've allowed the port 43594, did everything correct and I've used PFPortChecker to see it they're open, they ARE.
The problem I'm having is my computers firewall blocks connections, I would like it if it didn't.. you know.. so people can play my server..
I've used "canyouseeme . org" and this is the error i get
"Error: I could not see your service on 000.00.000.00 on port (43594) Reason: Connection refused"
000.00.000.00 = my ip address. (obviously not the real one)

item.title: Port Forwarding "Firewall problem", need quick help

item.description:
@smkscape wrote:

Did you add the port in firewall ? On your computer?

Read full topic
item.source: Port Forwarding "Firewall problem", need quick help

item.title: Port Forwarding "Firewall problem", need quick help
item.dc:creator: @themightydil12 themightydil12
item.description:
@themightydil12 wrote:

Hey try this:

Download “uTorrent” - Google it
then open CMD (Command Prompt)
and on the CMD type “ipconfig”
get the default gateway and type the default gateway on your web browser…
click settings and click on the services button
add a custom service call it “uTorrent”
on ports type “43594” -start and finish-
and then add an INBOUND SERVICE on “FIREWALL Rules!”
and then run your source
Install uTorrent and open it
NOTE: BEFORE FIRST USE uTorrent IT WILL ASK YOU IF YOU WANT TO LET IT THROUGH THE FIREWALL.
Press CTRL + P
CTRL + P will bring the Preferences tab op or you can CLICK ON Options and then preferences

Click on CONNECTIONS at the sidebar
Port used for incoming connections - 43594
Enable UPnP Port mapping
Enable NAT-PMP Port mapping
Add Windows Firewall exception
and do NOT CLICK ON RANDOMISE PORT AT START UP.
Click APPLY
Then OK

Note… ||RUN YOUR SERVER BEFORE YOU RUN uTorrent!

!!I’ve NEVER TESTED THIS PROPERLY!!
But it says port is open on “http://canyouseeme.org”

Read full topic
item.source: Port Forwarding "Firewall problem", need quick help
